"Sungai Sampah" di Bekasi Dibersihkan, Styrofoam Hingga Kulkas Dikeruk
03 Nov 2019, 11:37 by Tommi Andryandy
CIKARANG, (PR).- Pemerintah Kabupaten Bekasi akhirnya membersihkan sampah yang menutup ratusan meter badan sungai Kalijambe di Desa Satria Jaya, Kecamatan Tambun Utara, Minggu 3 November 2019.
Karena jumlahnya yang banyak, belum seluruh sampah dapat diangkut. Padahal, sampah yang diangkut telah lebih dari 15 truk. Bahkan, pembersihan telah dilakukan sejak Sabtu 2 November 2019.
“Memang masih banyak (sampah yang belum diangkut). Kemarin sudah 15 truk, sudah berkurang tapi tetap masih banyak (sampah),” kata Wakil Kepala Dusun III Desa Satria Jaya, Minan Royadi.
Pada pembersihan kali ini, sedikitnya 100 petugas gabungan dikerahkan. Mereka terdiri atas petugas Dinas Lingkungan Hidup Kabupaten Bekasi, dan petugas Kecamatan Tambun Utara yang dibantu warga yang menjadi relawan.



Selain belasan truk pengangkut sampah, turut diterjunkan eskavator yang membantu mengangkat sampah dari badan sungai. Pengangkutan sampah sempat tergganggu hujan.
Dalam sepekan terakhir, sampah menimbun sungai Kalijambe Bekasi. Ironisnya, ini menjadi kali kedua sungai Kalijambe Bekasi tertimbun sampah.
Hal serupa sempat terjadi awal September lalu. Setelah sempat dibersihkan, sampah kembali menutup badan sungai yang bermuara ke kanal Cikarang-Bekasi-Laut itu.



Meski telah diangkut, sampah masih mendominasi permukaan sungai Kalijambe Bekasi. Sungai masih tertutup sampah yang mayoritas merupakan kemasan makanan, baik yang berbahan plastik maupun styrofoam.
Tidak hanya itu, terdapat pula sampah berukuran besar lainnya seperti bantal, kasur, tempat duduk berbusa, hingga lemari es.
Warga jadi korban
Kepala Desa Satria Jaya, Asta Rajan mengatakan, pembersihan sungai Kalijambe Bekasi ditargetkan selesai Senin 4 November 2019.
Seluruh petugas dikerahkan untuk mengangkut sampah hingga dikirim ke tempat pembuangan akhir di Desa Burangkeng, Kecamatan Setu.
“Sampai besok diprediksi selesai. Sudah banyak sampah yang diangkut dan dibawa ke Burangkeng. Ini harus cepat karena sudah sangat mengganggu,” ucap dia.
Asta mengatakan, sampah yang menutupi sungai Kalijambe Bekasi bukan berasal dari daerahnya, melainkan kiriman dari daerah lain yang kemudian menumpuk di Desa Satria Jaya. Belum lagi, terdapat sejumlah usaha pengolahan barang rongsokan yang turut membuang sampah ke sungai.
“Warga kami yang justru jadi korban. Seminggu hujan, air membawa sampah. Di sini sungainya berbelok dan sampah menumpuk di sini. Kami jelas terganggu,” ucap dia.
Asta berharap kejadian ini tidak terus berulang. Dia menilai, penanganan sampah harus dilakukan secara menyeluruh, terutama di daerah yang dilalui sungai. “Kalau dari desa kami saja, jelas tidak bisa, karena sampah justru bukan dari kami. Harusnya ditangani sejak dari hulu. Saya juga sudah mengajukan pemasangan jaring di daerah perbatasan. Jadi tidak ada sampah yang mengalir ke sini,” ucap dia.
Camat Tambun Utara, Dodo mengatakan, dia telah menyalurkan pengajuan pembangunan jaring ke Pemkab Bekasi. Namun, selain jaring, edukasi terhadap warga yang tinggal di sekitar bantaran sungai perlu dilakukan.***

"Sungai Sampah" in Bekasi Is Cleaned, Styrofoam Up to the Refrigerator is Dredged
03 Nov 2019, 11:37 by Tommi Andryandy
CIKARANG, (PR) .- The Bekasi Regency government has finally cleared the garbage that covers hundreds of meters of the Kalijambe river body in Satria Jaya Village, Tambun Utara District, Sunday 3 November 2019.
Because of the large amount, not all trash can be transported yet. In fact, the garbage transported has more than 15 trucks. In fact, cleaning has been done since Saturday, November 2, 2019.
"Indeed there is still a lot (garbage that has not been transported). Yesterday there were 15 trucks, it has been reduced but there is still a lot (garbage), "said Deputy Head of Hamlet III of Satria Jaya Village, Minan Royadi.
In this cleanup, at least 100 joint officers were mobilized. They consisted of officers from the Bekasi Regency Environmental Agency, and North Tambun District officers who were assisted by residents who were volunteers.



In addition to dozens of garbage transport trucks, excavators were also deployed to help lift garbage from the river body. The transportation of garbage was interrupted by rain.
In the past week, garbage has been buried in the Kalijambe River, Bekasi. Ironically, this is the second time the Bekasi Kalijambe river is buried with rubbish.
Something similar happened at the beginning of September. After cleaning, the garbage again closed the river body which empties into the Cikarang-Bekasi-Laut canal.



Even though it has been transported, garbage still dominates the surface of the Kalijambe river in Bekasi. The river is still covered with garbage, the majority of which are food packaging, both plastic and styrofoam.
Not only that, there are also other large-sized garbage such as pillows, mattresses, foamy seats, and refrigerators.
Residents become victims
Satria Jaya Village Head, Asta Rajan, said that the Bekasi Kalijambe river cleanup is targeted to be completed on Monday, November 4, 2019.
All officers were mobilized to transport the waste until it was sent to a landfill in Burangkeng Village, Setu District.
"Until tomorrow it is predicted to be finished. Much garbage has been transported and brought to Burangkeng. It has to be fast because it's very annoying, "he said.
Asta said that the garbage covering the Kalijambe river in Bekasi was not from his area, but was sent from another area which then piled up in the village of Satria Jaya. Not to mention, there are a number of junk goods processing businesses that also throw garbage into the river.
"Our citizens are the victims. A rainy week, water brings rubbish. Here the river turns and rubbish builds up here. We are clearly disturbed, "he said.
Asta hopes that this incident will not repeat itself. He considered, the handling of waste must be done thoroughly, especially in areas crossed by rivers. "Even from our village, obviously we cannot, because the garbage is not from us. It should be handled from the upstream. I have also submitted a net installation in the border area. So there is no garbage flowing here, "he said.
Head of North Tambun Subdistrict, Dodo said, he had channeled the submission of the construction of a net to the Bekasi Regency Government. However, aside from nets, education is needed for residents who live near riverbanks. ***
